subject: RE: [junit] Class Not Found error--Urgent
msgSnippet: IMHO, the CLASSPATH seems to be your problem. now that you have junit.jar in your classpath, make sure you have your classes directory in your classpath. e.g.
messageBody:
IMHO, the CLASSPATH seems to be your problem.
now that you have junit.jar in your classpath, make sure
you have your classes directory in your classpath.
e.g. if you have your project directory structure as
C:\MyProject
-> src (source code)
-> classes (compiled classes)
make sure that you have C:\MyProject\classes in your classpath.
regards,
Nilesh

> -----Original Message-----
> From: anupama [mailto:anupama@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, June 24, 2003 11:29 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Class Not Found error--Urgent
>
>
> hi,
>
> When i am running TestHelloClass as
> junit.samples.TestHelloClass then it
> is displaying the error as Class not found
> "junit.samples.TestHelloClass"
>
> Please give me the solution.
>
> thanks
> Anupama
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Stevens, Timothy J. (LNG-ALB)"
> <timothy.j.stevens@...>
> To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>

>
>
> >
> > Are you running it via a command prompt? Are you running the test
> > from within the samples folder, or from the folder above?
> Which class
> cannot
> > be found?
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: anupama [mailto:anupama@...]

> >
> >
> > hi,
> >
> > I am facing any problem while running the sample
> testcases,but while
> > running my own testcases i am getting a problem as Class Not Found.
> >
> > My source code is :
> > package samples;
> >
> > public class HelloClass
> > {
> > public String sayHello()
> > {
> > return"Hello World";
> > }
> > }
> >
> > My TestCase is:
> > package samples;
> >
> > import samples.*;
> > import junit.framework.*;
> >
> > public class TestHelloClass extends TestCase
> > {
> > public TestHelloClass(String s)
> > {
> > super(s);
> > }
> >
> > public void testSayHello()
> > {
> > HelloClass helloObject= newHelloClass();
> > assertEquals(helloObject.sayHello(),"HelloWorld");
> > }
> >
> > public static void main(String[] args)
> > {
> > junit.awtui.TestRunner.run(TestHelloClass.class);
> > }
> >
> > }
> >
> > I have placed both the files in the samples folder itself.
> > when i am running the above testcase i am facing class not
> found error.
> > can anyone give me the solution for this problem.Its urgent.
> >
> > Thanks
> > Anupama
